SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes
Class PlanarSurface

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Node
      SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes.Shape
          SSG_Tools.SSG_Nodes.Shapes.PlanarSurface
All Implemented Interfaces:
IGL_Renderable
public class PlanarSurface
extends Shape

This class draws a rectangular plane surface in the x-z plane, centered at the origin, split into many smaller rectangles, to provide more vertices for the OpenGL lighting calculation. Texture coordinates from [0,max_s] and [0,max_t] are also generated using calls to glTexCoord2f(). Methods are provided to set the maximum s and t coordinates to be generated. The texture coordinates are assigned as follows. The "s" coordinate increases from 0 to max_s in the z-direction. The "t" coordinate increases from 0 to max_t in the x-direction. The texture coordinates (s,t) = (0,0) are assigned to the point (-width/2,0,-depth/2). NOTE: These explicitly generated texture coordinates will be used UNLESS Shape.setTexCoordGenMode() has been used to turn on automatic generation of texture coordinates by OpenGL. In that case, the automatically generated coordinates will take precedence over the values set by glTexCoord2f().

Constructor Detail

PlanarSurface

public PlanarSurface()
Construct a default PlanarSurface object with the width and depth both equal to 10, with 10 subdivisions in the width and depth direction. The default texture coordinates range from 0 to 1 in s and t, across the full surface.

PlanarSurface

public PlanarSurface(float width,
                     float depth,
                     int num_x,
                     int num_z)
Construct a PlanarSurface object with the specified width, height and number of subdivisions.

Parameters:
width - The total width of the plane in the "x" direction.
depth - The total depth of the plane in the "y" direction.
num_x - The number of rectangles to use in the x direction. If a negative or zero value is passed in, a default of 10 will be used.
num_z - The number of rectangles to use in the z direction. If a negative or zero value is passed in, a default of 10 will be used.
Method Detail

setMax_s

public void setMax_s(float max_s)
Set the maximum "s" texture coordinate value to use, if the explicitly generated texture coordinates are not overridden by texture coordinates generated by OpenGL due to calling Shape.setTexCoordGenMode().

Parameters:
max_s - the maximum texture coordinate "s" that is generated.

getMax_s

public float getMax_s()
Get the currently set value for the maximum "s" texture coordinate.

Returns:
max_s the maximum texture coordinate "s" that is generated.

Parameters:
max_t - the maximum texture coordinate "t" that is generated.
